links.title: The Bulls Ride Again as Facebook and The FAANG's Lead The Way!
links.description: Another exciting day of trading, with the bulls fighting the bears back. The bulls were on the brink of destruction when the S&P 500 hit a low of 2,584, and the Russell reach support at 1,433. But something interesting happened today because instead of the technology group leading the market lower, the leadership on the way down were the banks and energy.

links.title: China ruling could ban some Apple iPhones sales amid Qualcomm fight
links.description: Stock Markets 25 minutes ago (Dec 10, 2018 07:01PM ET) Â© Reuters. FILE PHOTO: The logo of Qualcomm is seen during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona By Stephen Nellis (Reuters) - Chip supplier Qualcomm (NASDAQ:) Inc said on Monday it had won an order from a Chinese court banning the sale of several older Apple Inc iPhone models in China because of two patent violations, although Apple said its phones remained on sale.

links.title: Apple ordered to stop selling iPhones in China, company claims
links.description: Apple has been banned by a court from selling iPhones in China, according to chip maker Qualcomm. The company says that a Chinese court has granted two preliminary injunctions that will force Apple to stop selling a whole range of iPhones released since the iPhone 6s.
